N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4211.1 - Purpose and types of assistance

State Regulations
(a) These regulations set forth the framework
for the administration by the New York State Urban Development Corporation (the

Corporation) of the Regional Economic Development Partnership Program (together
with all funds appropriated and reappropriated therefor, hereinafter referred
to as the REDPP or the program) which is authorized by section 16-e of the New

York State Urban Development Corporation Act. The REDPP is intended to provide
coordinated and comprehensive economic development assistance tailored to the
particular needs of eligible companies, industries and economic development
regions throughout the State. The REDPP is further intended to promote the
general welfare and prosperity of the State's citizens through a comprehensive
effort to strengthen the State's economic future and to provide new economic
opportunities for the State's citizens. (b) The following types of assistance are
available under the REDPP: (1)
business
development project loans and grants; (2)
tourism destination project loans and
grants; (3)
business infrastructure
project loans and grants; (4)
tourism destination infrastructure project loans and grants; (5)
infrastructure investment project
grants; (6)
infrastructure planning
project grants; (7)
child care
assistance project loans and grants; (8)
economic development assistance project
grants; (9)
skills training project
grants; (10)
revolving loan trust
fund account grants; and
(11)
regional strategic planning grants. (c) The provisions of sections 10 and 16(2)
of the New York State Urban Development Corporation Act shall not apply to any
project or assistance funded through the REDPP. Notes
